intro: Farsetia linearis, commonly known as the slender farsetia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its blooms, which range from white to pale yellow, appear in late winter to early spring. Farsetia linearis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to various garden conditions.
